TopicTitle: Mini Soyuz for the November 28th Anniversary

Articles.Content:
A tiny teeny weeny Soyuz using Twitches and Thuds, the anniversary of the first Soyuz is in a few days time, [COLOR=#252525][FONT=sans-serif]November 28, 1966, a few days after I was born[/FONT][/COLOR]. Look for Korolev's cross on booster separation. It will make a 70 to 75 km orbit, just. Make sure you leave the fairing on until above 50km.

To use LES Abort stages the fairing and then Action Group 1 to save the probe core!

Solar Panels deploy on Action Group 2

Discard front and rear sections of spacecraft in preparation for capsule re-entry on Action Group 3

[B][SIZE=5][URL="http://kerbalx.com/SelfishMeme/Mini-Soyuz"]Download[/URL][/SIZE][/B]

[IMG]http://i.imgur.com/oiskXEI.png[/IMG]

[IMG]http://i.imgur.com/2om4z7h.png[/IMG]

[IMGUR]xNGZ0[/IMGUR] Edited November 23, 2015 by selfish_meme

Awesome! I just happened to draw a Soyuz, and I didn't know the anniversary was on the 28th! Here is the link to my drawing of it: [url]http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/140362-Simple-Soyuz?p=2310909#post2310909[/url]
Wow. It's so tiny and so nice.

Hey man, a valiant effort indeed!

The motor placement is not correct however.. see this pic, this is how the engines are positioned:


[IMG]https://jdwaggoner.files.wordpress.com/2012/06/soyuz-engines.jpg[/IMG]


MJ

Aw bless! I've always loved how many thrusters Soyuz has. Great little craft! I'm going to assume it's HotRockets, but what mod/tex pack are you using for the exhausts?

Ryan

[quote name='Majorjim']Hey man, a valiant effort indeed!

The motor placement is not correct however.. see this pic, this is how the engines are positioned:


[url]https://jdwaggoner.files.wordpress.com/2012/06/soyuz-engines.jpg[/url]


MJ[/QUOTE]

I'll move them around, aint no big deal

Ryan[/QUOTE]

Using real plume

Agreed! A minor issue on a lovely looking rocket. Little rockets are so much fun to fly. Good job man.
